required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intramuscular Injections of Botulinum Toxin in Lateral Pterygoid Muscle in the Treatment of Temporomandibular Dysfunctions: Studying the Interest of MRI Guidance and Ultrasound Guidance
clinical_study.official_title: Intramuscular Injections of Botulinum Toxin in Lateral Pterygoid Muscle in the Treatment of Temporomandibular Dysfunctions: Studying the Interest of MRI Guidance and Ultrasound Guidance

brief_summary.textblock: The main hypothesis is that a significant pain improve (measured with Visual Analogic Scale [VAS]) can be observed after injection of botulinum toxin A, meaning the success of the guidance device.

primary_outcome.description: Significant improvement of the pain measured with VAS (0 to 10), corresponding to at least 30% decrease of the pain after injection of botulinum toxin A

arm_group.description: Injections of botulinum toxin performed using MRI guidance
Injections of botulinum toxin performed using ultrasound guidance

intervention.description: Injections of botulinum toxin performed using MRI guidance
Injections of botulinum toxin performed using ultrasound guidance
